item.title: Report E-2024060543
item.description:
Report E-2024060543

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 4-gallons of Grain Alcohol 200 proof released from one (1) 350-gallon IBC metal tote impacting the concrete dock floor. The lid had popped off during transit. ERTS reviewed the SDS with terminal personnel who felt comfortable cleaning the release with oil dri and the proper PPE available on site. The waste was containerized into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060538
item.description:
Report E-2024060538

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and placed the recovered spent absorbents into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024060392
item.description:
Report X-2024060392

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was not processed HAP and put it in the Yellow Hazmat salvage drum. There is no indication of package being processed as HAZMAT from the origin station and arrived to the destination station to be delivered for recipient in yellow Hazmat salvage drum. The Hazmat package have OK to load sticker on the package. Upon inspection of the package the cap is loose and leaking.

item.title: Report E-2024060498
item.description:
Report E-2024060498

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from two (2) 5-gallon plastic pails impacting the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the damaged pails and spent cleanup debris into two (2) 20-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060497
item.description:
Report E-2024060497

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: while unloading drums into warehouse the closure ring for an open head drum of paint related material was not on correctly. When the fork truck with drum clips went to pick up the drum the lid popped off and material spilled. no material went offsite, and the material was cleaned up in house and properly managed.
